page.title: 02Durlston Country Park
page.content: An important part of our study area is known as Durlston Country Park. It was established by Dorset County Council with aid from the Countryside Commission in 1973. It consists of 260 acres of unspoilt countryside for public recreation. At the same time it is a conservation area,containing a rich variety of grassland, hedgerow, woodland and cliff life; supporting nearly 400 species of wild flower, 32 species of butterfly and over two hundred types of bird have been recorded. A large part of the Country Park has been designated a Site of Special Scientific Interest for its geological and wildlife attractions.
